title: De Morgan's Law - Part 1
course: Discrete Mathematics by Prof Sudarshan Iyengar

transcript.text: Look at these two ladies. I make  this statement. Both of them are
good looking. I repeat both of them are good  looking. When do you think I'll be wrong?
Both of them are not good looking? Not  really. I will be wrong rather my statement,
my statement, this statement that both  of them are good looking will be wrong,
will be false if one of them at  least is not good looking. Right?
This is what we mean by what is  popularly called the De Morgan's Law.
